messageBody:
This is unfortunately a frequent request, and well beyond my knowledge of
Java threading. If anyone knows how to find out the current stacktrace of a
separate thread, please let the list know, and we will incorporate it in
JUnit.

We could use JDI to run the thread in another JVM, but that seems fairly
high-cost (in terms of compatibility and dependency) for what we'd get.

For any particular instance where a test is timing out, running with a
profiler can often point out the high-cost operations, which is usually more
interesting than the single sample of what the thread was doing at the exact
timeout.

David Saff
